content.description: Crux is between the first and second bolts, look for the hidden hold.
content.protection: Bolts, anchor and chain at the top
content.location: Right of Aunt Bea, climb a shallow corner for the first two bolts.  Rap the route

climbs.name: Opie
climbs.fa: Bryan Pletta and Karl Kiser, Winter 2011

content.location: The leftmost route on the center terrace.

content.description: The crux is around the middle of the route.
content.protection: Bolts, anchor and chains at the top.
content.location: The leftmost route on the Terrace center.  Rap the route.

content.description:
Starts the same as Berna Town but goes left after the third bolt after the hardest climbing.  From here work up and around the bulge using good holds.  According to the info on the Terrace Home page it's 12c, but unless I've got the routes mixed up, this is very soft. Fun route though, with some cleaning and traffic it would be really nice, I'll leave it as 12a/b for now.

 If I do have the routes mixed up let me know, but this fit the description on the Terrace home page.  I also clipped the anchors to the left rather than Berna Town's  anchors to avoid drag.
content.location: Far left of the big roof, it goes up too the roof/bulge but goes left around it instead of over it.

content.description: Again, haven't been on this yet but I will soon and I'll put better info up asap. Starts same as Hale Bopp, but goes right through bulge after some face climbing.
content.location: Start same as Hale Bopp, far left of the roof and is the first route that tackles it.
Second from the left on the center terrace.

content.description: The middle section is actually the Terrace proper.
